# gitignore-commands.txt

# Common .gitignore Patterns:
# Ignore node_modules directory (for Node.js projects)
node_modules/

# Ignore the build/ directory (for build outputs)
build/

# Ignore MacOS system files
.DS_Store

# Ignore IDE files (e.g., for Visual Studio Code)
.vscode/

# Ignore log files
*.log

# Ignore OS-generated files
Thumbs.db

# Git Commands Related to .gitignore:

# To check the status of ignored files
git status

# To show all ignored files in your repository
git ls-files --ignored --exclude-standard --others

# To remove a file from Git's tracking while keeping it locally
git rm --cached <file_name>

# To update your .gitignore (e.g., add new files or patterns)
nano .gitignore

# To create a global .gitignore file for all repositories
git config --global core.excludesfile ~/.gitignore_global
